reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11604, 'name': 'sean mooney', 'email': 'smooney@redhat.com', 'username': 'sean-k-mooney'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 21672, 'name': 'Sundar Nadathur', 'email': 'sundar.nadathur@intel.com', 'username': 'nsundar'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}]

[{'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-13 16:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-12-13 16:56:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I suspect there is history on this that I've forgotten, in which case please ignore me.

But I'm confused: Isn't the presence of inventory (that is, a resource class with some value) the way that a compute indicates it can handle accelerator requests?"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-13 17:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

cdent: This is with reference to the scenario where the Nova conductor has my patches for Cyborg integration, but the compute manager in one or more nodes is an older version, without the corresponding changes. By default, Placement may pick one of the older nodes, because the Cyborg agent there has published inventory as nested RPs on that compute node. But then the flow will break silently: the conductor would have initiated accelerator request (ARQ) binding, while the compute manager will silently ignore it, causing a resource leak in Cyborg.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-13 17:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

cdent: This trait prevents that problem, because it will be published only by compute nodes that have my changes from:
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/status:open+project:openstack/nova+bp/nova-cyborg-interaction 

We will propose patches that get the scheduler t query Placement with this trait.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-12-13 17:12:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I suspect there is history on this that I've forgotten, in which
 > case please ignore me.
 > 
 > But I'm confused: Isn't the presence of inventory (that is, a
 > resource class with some value) the way that a compute indicates it
 > can handle accelerator requests?

In this case, Cyborg is adding the inventory, not the compute. So the compute may not be new enough to support the accelerators, but Cyborg may have added the inventory anyway. The trait provides a way for Cyborg to tell, as well as a way for nova-api to know that nova-compute is capable."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-12-13 17:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-12-13 17:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add a trait that compute manager can handle accelerator requests.

When a Cyborg device profile name is present in the flavor, the
conductor will initiate creation and binding of accelerator requests,
and the compute manager must wait for the ARQ binding notifications.

In a deployment where the conductor is new, but one or more compute
managers are older than the needed version, this flow will break.
To prevent that: (a) the compute manager publishes this trait,
and (b) the scheduler factors this trait in the Placement query, so
that older compute nodes are not included in allocation candidates.

Change-Id: I6dc00248b54f3a8a5d5dae284d2182df5ba550ab

messages:
[{'account_id': 31556, 'date': '2020-01-29 10:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-01-29 10:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-01-29 11:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(WIP) Fix the pre-installation scripts

Pre-installation scripts are now not fully compatible with some platforms such
as CentOS7 or RHEL7 due to the migrating to Python3 and need a fix.

Python 3 version.

Change-Id: I8bec32c5e0dae2dee27615146f946a9649f23fd1

commit_message:
Use correct command for Python virtualenv

Using the virtualenv command will generate a virtualenv with the
default python exec for the entire system, that means that even
if DIB_PYTHON is python3, the virtualenv will use python2.
With this change we use the venv embedded command if the version
of Python is 3.x to generate a virtualenv with the correct
Python 3 version.

Change-Id: I8bec32c5e0dae2dee27615146f946a9649f23fd1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-01 12:10:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix qemu loading of ceph.conf (permission error)

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu, not libvirt.
Since qemu runs as the nova user, ceph.conf owned by root
causes a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

This change fixes the issue by changing the ownership of ceph.conf
in nova-libvirt to the nova user.

Closes-Bug: #1861513
Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91910d2a455f66e5f014a04bedf132fe0cab55ea)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix qemu loading of ceph.conf (permission error)

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu, not libvirt.
Since qemu runs as the nova user, ceph.conf owned by root
causes a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

This change fixes the issue by changing the ownership of ceph.conf
in nova-libvirt to the nova user.

Closes-Bug: #1861513
Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
(cherry picked from commit 91910d2a455f66e5f014a04bedf132fe0cab55ea)

Additional follow up concern is question whether this ensures that dnsmasq is ready to respond before the guest makes a DHCP request? If it's queuing it vs waiting for it to complete, this means it is "hopefully ready" by the time the queue eventually gets processes. For a fast enough guest, this might mean it's up and queries for DHCP before it is ready and it has to retry?

This makes me think that caller should watch for the batch to be processed before returning success?'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-01-06 17:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Enable bulk updates for the dnsmasq

Instead of restarting the dnsmasq agent for every IP we do this
in bulk. That is, if a network has N updates in X seconds then we will
restart the process once with the ports configured in the X seconds and
not N Times.

A new configuration variable have been added:

- bulk_reload_interval - time to wait between bulk reloads. This is 0 by
  default to ensure backwards compatibility. If the value is not 0 the
  new functionlay is invoked.

Change-Id: Ieff5ce4506fd4e7fa427eb50c50fbe316f67103f

commit_message:
Fix documentation, replace src_file to path_to_backup

This patch is fixing documentation as freezer_action's 'src_file'
option is not used in a code, instead of this option 'path_to_backup'
is used.

Change-Id: I908a310c4252db49ac74f2396e2e27184fe0f3f1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-30 19:00:27.000000000', 'message': 'Support TEMPEST_BRANCH with tag name

TEMPEST_BRANCH which is mostly set as master so
that Tempest master is run to test the env. With
stable branch going to EM state and Tempest master
might not work due to incompatibility of code or
requirements. In that case we pin the Tempest so that
older Tempest can be used for their testing.

Till now for ocata, pike and, queens we used the gerrit style
ref to pin the Tempest which is not preferred way. We should be
able to use the tag name on TEMPEST_BRANCH.

This commit explicitly checkout the tag set in TEMPEST_BRANCH
as git_clone does not checkout the tag directly until RECLONE
is true or tempest dir does not exist.

After this stable branch or job can set the tag directly with name.
For exmaple: TEMPEST_BRANCH=23.0.0.

Change-Id: Ic777e4b56c4932dde135ac909cb5c6f4a7d5cc78

commit_message:
Support TEMPEST_BRANCH with tag name

TEMPEST_BRANCH which is mostly set as master so
that Tempest master is run to test the env. With
stable branch going to EM state and Tempest master
might not work due to incompatibility of code or
requirements. In that case we pin the Tempest so that
older Tempest can be used for their testing.

Till now for ocata, pike and, queens we used the gerrit style
ref to pin the Tempest which is not preferred way. We should be
able to use the tag name on TEMPEST_BRANCH.

This commit explicitly checkout the tag set in TEMPEST_BRANCH
as git_clone does not checkout the tag directly until RECLONE
is true or tempest dir does not exist.

After this stable branch or job can set the tag directly with name.
For exmaple: TEMPEST_BRANCH=23.0.0.

Also replace gerrit style Tempest ref to tag to make
this change working.

Change-Id: Ic777e4b56c4932dde135ac909cb5c6f4a7d5cc78

commit_message:
Support TEMPEST_BRANCH with tag name

TEMPEST_BRANCH which is mostly set as master so
that Tempest master is run to test the env. With
stable branch going to EM state and Tempest master
might not work due to incompatibility of code or
requirements. In that case we pin the Tempest so that
older Tempest can be used for their testing.

Till now for ocata, pike and, queens we used the gerrit style
ref to pin the Tempest which is not preferred way. We should be
able to use the tag name on TEMPEST_BRANCH.

This commit explicitly checkout the tag set in TEMPEST_BRANCH
as git_clone does not checkout the tag directly until RECLONE
is true or tempest dir does not exist.

After this stable branch or job can set the tag directly with name.
For exmaple: TEMPEST_BRANCH=23.0.0.

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-qinlingclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Id33d34fd89a4fa10f1c60354b91268898289ba9c

commit_message:
Improve the function tests

- Execute test groups in serial to make sure no more than 2 database
  instance are created at the same time.
- Remove some unneccesary tests
- Remove unneeded datastore, e.g. 'Test_Datastore_1'
- Remove unsupported trovestack subcommands
- Move unsupported DIB elements to the 'deprecated-elements' folder
- Decrease default value of 'agent_call_high_timeout' to 5min
- Add initial_deplay for pooling task
- Use socket file to connect with database instead of using localhost
  IP

Change-Id: Ie5030a671fbeb453eafa6cbe04e08da7b52e33c9

[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Fix test_titles.py for changed generator syntax.

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I334a97d3a0d144b233f51dc864eb56eb6057a064

[{'created': '2020-01-28 14:52:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix packaging issue by devolving it to principal

This patchset fixes the referenced bug by making use a new feature
in the openstack-dashboard charm to allow this plugin to indicate
which packages need installing and which conflict.

The two depends-on are the openstack-dashboard patch to add the
packaging feature and the charm-interface-dashboard-plugin patch
that adds the package details to the reactive interface code.

commit_message:
Fix packaging issue by devolving it to principal

This patchset fixes the referenced bug by making use a new feature
in the openstack-dashboard charm to allow this plugin to indicate
which packages need installing and which conflict.

The two depends-on are the openstack-dashboard patch to add the
packaging feature and the charm-interface-dashboard-plugin patch
that adds the package details to the reactive interface code.

Also remove disco test and add eoan-train test due to disco EOL.

Depends-On: I962ec558b8dd1f765c6104d5ae61edd41c03affe
Depends-On: Ib3fc0b0525dabf70f45fd050af2ed05ba31129b9
Change-Id: I8582a4cf62749240919d0fe4dd5d72577d288397
Closes-Bug: #1853851

commit_message:
Move create_or_update_port to zun/network/neutron.py

This allows the code to be reused by runtimes that are not using
kuryr.

Change-Id: I758883e348fc5980224381167e85c4cda5c3a155

commit_message:
Increate tox-py38 timeout to 3600 seconds

Days after [1] was merged, [2] was merged too, adding a new CI job:
py38. This patch amends [1] increasing the timeout for this new job.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703751
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693401

Change-Id: I128f3c4621d2354ac6b0d07ccf34b84862efe7de
Closes-Bug: #1860332

[{'account_id': 30366, 'date': '2019-08-23 08:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-23 08:32:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

IMO you shouldn't consider merging this until the oot CI is passing *at least* regressively. Really you should make sure it is running (and passing) some cold migration tests.

I'll come back and review the code again once that's been addressed."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-08 16:00:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

2:46:17 AM - _rajat_: Hi Eric,
 2:46:17 AM - _rajat_: I have some regarding your review comment in
 2:46:17 AM - _rajat_: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678179/15
 2:48:10 AM - _rajat_: as cold migration uses resize flow only and test for that has been modified for cold migration also.
 2:48:10 AM - _rajat_: can you suggest what else need to be done

Assume you're talking about this:

> IMO you shouldn't consider merging this until the oot CI is passing
> *at least* regressively. Really you should make sure it is running 
> (and passing) some cold migration tests.

You've updated the unit tests, and that's fine. But it's easy to make unit tests pass without in any way proving that the feature *works*.

At a minimum with a driver change like this you need to prove that it does not regress existing functionality. As noted above, unit tests are not sufficient for this. My main gripe here is that the PowerVM CI hasn't posted results on this patch, ever. So at the very least that needs to happen before you should consider merging.

But ideally you should *also* add some specific cold migration tests to the CI. Not sure if this...

 2:48:10 AM - _rajat_: as cold migration uses resize flow only and test for that has been modified for cold migration also.

...was referring to the unit tests updated in the patch or to the CI. If the former, see my comments above. Otherwise:

If this patch is needed at all, it must be because cold migration wasn't working (properly) before. Which means you should be able to demonstrate at least one test scenario in the CI that fails without the patch, and succeeds with it.

All of that said, this project (despite its openness) is owned by IBM, and since I'm no longer with IBM, you should not feel obligated to treat my reviews as blocking (and I promise not to use my -2 powers if you want to continue keeping me on the core team)."}, {'account_id': 30366, 'date': '2020-01-09 10:18:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 30366, 'date': '2020-01-09 15:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 30366, 'date': '2020-01-10 06:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18: Patch Set 17 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-27 21:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

powervm: recheck'}, {'account_id': 16551, 'date': '2020-01-28 12:18:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

> powervm: recheck

Eric, The PowerVM CI env is currently having issues and might take a while before it's restored to it's original state. If it's going to take longer than expected, we will look at getting this merged as it's affecting our U-release deliverables."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-28 15:17:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

> If it's going to take longer than expected, we will look at getting this merged as it's affecting our U-release deliverables.

That's up to you of course, but it's not good project hygiene. If you're going to do that, I suggest including a fat gerrit comment describing your rationale and conveying results of manual local testing."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-02-02 12:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 30366, 'date': '2020-02-02 16:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

- Skip check for RMC state during migration

- Skipping check for reducing disk size in case of cold migration.

- Fix error with NVRAM download during cold migration

  On Novalink hosts, if the VM is deployed using
  a custom compute template having "Remote restart
  enabled" value set to "False", the nvram data will
  not be uploaded to the swift repo. During cold
  migration of such VM the operation will fail with
  NVRAM not found exception. This fix is to handle this
  case and continue with the cold migrate operation
  instead of failing the same

commit_message:
Changes required for Cold Migration

- "block_device_info" required to delete instance that migrated form
  one host to another

- Skip check for RMC state during migration

- Skipping check for reducing disk size in case of cold migration.

- Fix error with NVRAM download during cold migration

  On Novalink hosts, if the VM is deployed using
  a custom compute template having "Remote restart
  enabled" value set to "False", the nvram data will
  not be uploaded to the swift repo. During cold
  migration of such VM the operation will fail with
  NVRAM not found exception. This fix is to handle this
  case and continue with the cold migrate operation
  instead of failing the same

Change-Id: I8ad1fc2852e0a281c8a48b207ea4fd2f2beac467

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.
This change showed we needed a newer version of debtcollector in lower
constraints, aliging with the version required by os-vif. This change
showed we needed also a newer version of cffi and keystoneauth1 in lower
constraints. Update also the requirements file for debtcollector and
keystoneauth1.

Change-Id: I5e190c3db8bed0a264b911cdf425aa4c9b51f768

commit_message:
Improve share list speed using lazy='subquery'

lazy='immediate' leads to each relationship being collected when
it is accessed. This results in at least three extra queries when
we query for all share details. lazy='subquery' collects all data
when the query is executed. In this commit we only changed code for
improving the share list with details ("manila list") speed.

Change-Id: Ia61b108ece0817069737980a614cc6c15c1a3507
Closes-Bug: #1859785
Co-authored-by: Johannes Kulik <johannes.kulik@sap.com>
Co-authored-by: Maurice Escher <maurice.escher@sap.com>
(cherry picked from commit 54c5667e6b4a37270c4aed64b9a5ebd5f31bfa16)
(cherry picked from commit f01e48557863a4b6d4e75fe368e0185652aab09f)

commit_message:
Fix jobs not running and add new ones to the gate

Jobs like the barbican and active-standby were not being run in CI
because of the irrelevant-files list set in octavia-tempest-plugin. We
need to override that list in the octavia project.

This patch also adds spare pool and active-standby (replacing the
iptables-based one) jobs to the check and gate queues.

Change-Id: I26cbf5d39dc8857026dda58eb705e6b1fc807544

commit_message:
Stop supporting CentOS 7 controllers and images

The diskimage-create.sh tool will now default to CentOS 8 when building
CentOS-based amphora images.

This patch also removes leftover references to support for Ubuntu Trusty
and Xenial.

Change-Id: I3aba59c8dd86aeeee28cc6a67af93697912fb55b

commit_message:
return py27 to voting

cloudnull the incredible and slayed the
py27 dragon and brought back it's head.
He also returned w/ a working py27 unit
test job that allows dlrn builds to
also work properly.

Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704859/

subject: Use ctlplane for internal QDR communication
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5241, 'name': 'Martin Magr', 'email': 'mmagr@redhat.com', 'username': 'mmagr'}, {'_account_id': 6924, 'name': 'Pradeep Kilambi', 'email': 'pkilambi@redhat.com', 'username': 'pkilambi'}, {'_account_id': 7294, 'name': 'Leif Madsen', 'email': 'lmadsen@redhat.com', 'username': 'leifmadsen'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-15 21:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-16 12:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-01-16 13:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-16 20:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-17 10:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-17 15:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1 (1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:25:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Dropping in a little late to the party, but why switch to the control plane?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-20 16:58:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: @Juan, because the interior mesh is constructed from QDRs running on controller nodes and controller_node_ips hiera gives you list of interfaces on ctlplane :). @Alex, do you want me to change it back to interior_ip? From my PoV it is only a name basically telling the same information, so I don't mind."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-20 17:11:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Yes please, I think the previous patch set is more correct. I'm sorry"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2020-01-21 07:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: @Martin: Right, but from an architecture perspective, is it the right call? Wouldn't you really want this to be in the internal-api network given te nature of this traffic?"}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-21 09:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2020-01-21 09:24:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1 Can you set this via t-h-t instead? That way at least the network would be configurable. I'm not very keen on using the ctlplane network for this. But, if you make it a default and make it configurable, that would be better than hardcoding it like this."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-01-21 09:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1 I tend to agree with Juan on that: ctlplane shouldn't be used, at least not hard-coded, for this usage. Ideally, we should get a dedicated "metric" network - it might come later (hint-hint ;)). Dedicated network would help filter out metrics traffic from the "other stuff" in a neat way, allowing to get precise network consumption, even on ctlplane (which is, for the records, a management/deploy network). Making it, at least, configurable, would be a plus, and might even help people set their own metric network (or use the API one) instead. I didn't realize you were going to use ctlplane like that when you pushed https://review.opendev.org/702892 ...'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-21 09:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: > I tend to agree with Juan on that: ctlplane shouldn't be used, at > least not hard-coded, for this usage. > Ideally, we should get a dedicated "metric" network - it might come > later (hint-hint ;)). Yes, metrics network implementation is in plan, but currently we need to use the network on which all nodes has access and the one for which interface addresses of controllers are collected. > Dedicated network would help filter out > metrics traffic from the "other stuff" in a neat way, allowing to > get precise network consumption, even on ctlplane (which is, for > the records, a management/deploy network). > > Making it, at least, configurable, would be a plus, and might even > help people set their own metric network (or use the API one) > instead. Uhm ... it is configurable. The ctlplane interface is set just as a default via hiera. > > I didn't realize you were going to use ctlplane like that when you > pushed https://review.opendev.org/702892 ...'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2020-01-21 12:14:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: By configurable, I was hoping for an entry in the serviceNetMap and the usage of that to set up the network in t-h-t. That way, there would be a single and explicit place where the deployer can overwrite the network (just like it's possible for other services). Instead of having to dig through code to get this one hiera key."}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-22 10:02:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: This patch was the last piece of puzzle, meant to fix the broken code which was already working on ctlplane simply because currently there is no other way to get list of IP addresses of controllers only other than on ctlplane (eg. controller_node_ips hiera variable). I don't understand why we cannot have this fix now and iterate on moving the traffic to internal_api the correct way?"}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2020-01-22 10:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Why exactly do you need the addresses of the controllers? because the QDR service is hosted in them? You can also get the address of the nodes that host a specific service, we have hiera keys for that too; and that'll work for any network. See this: https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/blob/stable/train/manifests/haproxy.pp#L925 for example. You could do the same for QDR as long as it's a service."}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-22 16:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Because metric QDRs are running in different mode on controller (interior mode) than on other types of nodes (edge mode). If I will use metrics-qdr_node_ips, it will contain list of all the nodes.'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-01-29 22:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Any progress on this? We really need to get this fixed and merged. This is really blocking us.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-01-30 14:11:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 While I understand Juan's concern about the ability to override the network by an operator who would want to, it's also possible for this operator to do it via ExtraConfig if needed with overriding the hieradata of tripleo::profile::base::metrics::qdr::interior_ip. I guess this is acceptable now and I hope we can clean this up soon, to have a proper ServiceNetMap in THT as requested."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-01-30 14:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review As discussed already - there's a real plan to make this better, and I think we can accept the current patch, provided it will be "corrected" soon with a dedicated network and a proper way to use it. Removing my -1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-01-30 14:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-01-30 14:22:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1 I'm not comfortable in this area to +2 and merge. But I can ensure that we will add this to our backlog and fix it as a follow up."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-30 15:04:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1 This really should come from THT and not relying on the ctlplane hiera data.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2020-01-30 15:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Well, seems this was already merged. Bummer this is not usable for certain edge deployments given the hardcoded ctlplane and non-trivial way to change it.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-01-30 17:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: "Error: unable to pull 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleomaster/centos-binary-cron:6d67ae9682c5ab2fa6c9fc2e44970d8ad4a53673_3bda53e2-updated-20200130162357: unable to pull image: Error initializing source docker://192.168.24.1:8787/tripleomaster/centos-binary-cron:6d67ae9682c5ab2fa6c9fc2e44970d8ad4a53673_3bda53e2-updated-20200130162357: Error reading manifest 6d67ae9682c5ab2fa6c9fc2e44970d8ad4a53673_3bda53e2-updated-20200130162357 in 192.168.24.1:8787/tripleomaster/centos-binary-cron: error parsing HTTP 404 response body: invalid character '<' looking for beginning of value: \"\\n\\n404 Not Found\\n\\n

Not Found

\\n

The requested URL /v2/tripleomaster/centos-binary-cron/manifests/6d67ae9682c5ab2fa6c9fc2e44970d8ad4a53673_3bda53e2-updated-20200130162357 was not found on this server.

\\n\\n\"", https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_a83/702754/8/gate/tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-undercloud-minion/a83eed9/ failed in gate.. probably bad luck'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-31 10:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: recheck'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-01-31 17:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: recheck'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-02-01 20:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: recheck'}]

commit_message:
Use ctlplane for internal QDR communication

This patch makes interior metrics QDR use ctlplane interfaces for which
ports are opened on THT side.

Change-Id: Ie1394d6f6977d8ae3a4e57015cc8c3b2ec7a6f3d

commit_message:
Improve molecule testing

- removes linting from molecule (we do it ourselves)
- better parallel execution
- easier to read output

Change-Id: I0d22ba72a02575298c2bd6bfaca1285ad0719a26

Update ffwd-upgrade branch names

The next iteration of fast-forward-upgrade will be
from queens through to train, so we update the names
accordingly.

commit_message:
Split capsule code out of container driver

Introduce a capsule driver in parallel with container driver.
Capsule logic goes to capsule driver and container logic goes to
container driver.

Change-Id: I0c3efdb0068cfa89b8cfc6cad68425838cd2e50f

commit_message:
Disable gzip on upstream and enable on OVB

leave gzipping on non-OVB jobs in 3party as it allows to
browse gzipped files.
Closes-Bug: #1861378
Change-Id: I4f6aaba81c91bc015d67c9c03de44f09ed0a66b1

the issue: artcl_publish' is undefined.

Change-Id: Icb34b55f12eb5b1df86d7f227df5ef191fd25bb2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix undefined variable in infrared tasks

When using ansible-role-collect-logs with Infrared, we hit
the issue: artcl_publish' is undefined.

This change sets a default for this variable in the conditional
which makes use of it.

Change-Id: Icb34b55f12eb5b1df86d7f227df5ef191fd25bb2

[{'created': '2020-01-31 18:18:30.000000000', 'message': "Ensure store ID parsed from URI is properly encoded

Ensure the store ID parsed from a request URI is unicode. This fixes
a py27 issue that allowed an incorrectly encoded value to be added to
the image's metadata.

Support for py27 is dropped in Ussuri, but this fix is required on
earlier releases that do support py27.

Closes-Bug: #1861501
Change-Id: I5a1c61430879a910e7b6c79effba538431959d56
(cherry picked from commit 8649fdc2a293009899d2aa918ec360e30adc8e77)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure store ID parsed from URI is properly encoded

Ensure the store ID parsed from a request URI is unicode. This fixes
a py27 issue that allowed an incorrectly encoded value to be added to
the image's metadata.

Support for py27 is dropped in Ussuri, but this fix is required on
earlier releases that do support py27.

Closes-Bug: #1861501
Change-Id: I5a1c61430879a910e7b6c79effba538431959d56
(cherry picked from commit 8649fdc2a293009899d2aa918ec360e30adc8e77)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-20 15:30:33.000000000', 'message': "PoC for using COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE

This is a proof of concept for how I envision the
COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait [1] getting used
by the API during a cold migration to filter out hosts
that cannot support same-host cold migration, which is
all of them except for the hosts using the vCenter driver.

It also shows how the workaround config option from [2]
would be deprecated once we can start using the trait.
As for why we don't just go straight to using the trait,
it's because the workaround config option is backportable
but the trait (being a standard trait) is not. If we don't
care about backports for this latent bug then we could
just drop [2] and fix this on master alone.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/666604/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/676022/

Change-Id: I7a4b951f3ab324c666ab924e6003d24cc8e539f5
Closes-Bug: #1748697
Related-Bug: #1811235

'}, {'created': '2019-12-12 22:15:36.000000000', 'message': "Use COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait during migrate

This uses the COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait in the
API during a cold migration to filter out hosts that cannot
support same-host cold migration, which is all of them except
for the hosts using the vCenter driver.

For any nodes that do not report the trait, we won't know if
they don't because they don't support it or if they are not
new enough to report it, so the API has a service version check
and will fallback to old behavior using the config if the node
is old. That compat code can be removed in the next release.

As a result of this the FakeDriver capabilities are updated
so the FakeDriver no longer supports same-host cold migration
and a new fake driver is added to support that scenario for
any tests that need it.

Change-Id: I7a4b951f3ab324c666ab924e6003d24cc8e539f5
Closes-Bug: #1748697
Related-Bug: #1811235

commit_message:
Use COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait during migrate

This uses the COMPUTE_SAME_HOST_COLD_MIGRATE trait in the API during a
cold migration to filter out hosts that cannot support same-host cold
migration, which is all of them except for the hosts using the vCenter
driver.

For any nodes that do not report the trait, we won't know if they don't
because they don't support it or if they are not new enough to report
it, so the API has a service version check and will fallback to old
behavior using the config if the node is old. That compat code can be
removed in the next release.

As a result of this the FakeDriver capabilities are updated so the
FakeDriver no longer supports same-host cold migration and a new fake
driver is added to support that scenario for any tests that need it.

Change-Id: I7a4b951f3ab324c666ab924e6003d24cc8e539f5
Closes-Bug: #1748697
Related-Bug: #1811235

commit_message:
Update template overrides for rabbitmq

Kolla will upgrade and pin rabbitmq version to 3.8.2 for Ussuri, so need
to update tripleo template overrides. This adds the new pin, which will
be cleaned up on a follow on review.

Change-Id: If18e88a95185c7169641243e9d8e54fa51407ba7

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Allow SSH access to keystone_ssh and nova_ssh

The centos:8 image contains a /run/nologin file, which prevents SSH
access to it. Remove this file in the keystone_ssh and nova_ssh images
to allow login via SSH.

Change-Id: I59dc2c4207af6812501b6c6acdb34e51a3e848c4
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Relax ironic iPXE EFI bootloader location

CentOS 7 had ipxe.efi. CentOS 8 has ipxe-i386.efi and ipxe-x86_64.efi.
Use a wildcard to copy any of these that are present.

Change-Id: I6d409e56b424a039f5aff9af86ca1b026c2c6286
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 16:09:51.000000000', 'message': 'fix permission error when qemu-kvm load ceph.conf

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu-kvm, not libvirt directly.
since qemu-kvm is running by nova user, currently ceph.conf
owned by root will cause a permission error. logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveals the error.

Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-12-11 10:00:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix permission error when qemu-kvm loads ceph.conf

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu-kvm, not libvirt directly.  Since qemu-kvm
is running as the nova user, currently ceph.conf owned by root will
cause a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

This change fixes the issue by changing the ownership of ceph.conf in
nova-libvirt to the nova user.

Closes-Bug: #1855922
Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-01-15 09:16:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix permission error when qemu-kvm loads ceph.conf

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu-kvm, not libvirt directly.  Since qemu-kvm
is running as the nova user, currently ceph.conf owned by root will
cause a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

commit_message:
Fix qemu loading of ceph.conf (permission error)

ceph.conf is loaded by qemu, not libvirt.
Since qemu runs as the nova user, ceph.conf owned by root
causes a permission error. The logs in
/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-*.log reveal the error.

This change fixes the issue by changing the ownership of ceph.conf
in nova-libvirt to the nova user.

Closes-Bug: #1861513
Change-Id: I1881f51a6c8508f0f186a5623443343dc1df41d4
Signed-off-by: Ning Yao <yaoning@unitedstack.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-01-24 06:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-01-24 06:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Reason for backport request: the certfs-ramfs systemd service fails on cryptsetup>=2.1.0 (available in CentOS 8.1) and so this patch fixes it.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2020-01-30 20:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-02-01 05:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-24 06:31:01.000000000', 'message': "Use LUKS1 for certfs-ramfs for all distributions

This commit forces the use of LUKS1 in cryptsetup.

Centos uses LUKS2 by default in cryptsetup, ubuntu uses LUKS1.
Formating a LUKS2 block device is way longer than formating a LUKS1
device (15 sec vs 8 sec in my env) and LUKS2 doesn't provide any
significant features for octavia (it only improves recovery and
metadata).

The commit aslo limits the creation of more than 1 block ram device
(amphora doesn't need 16 ram devices), which reduces startup time.

Change-Id: I5cdc0a9ccc01548f195eed80f2ee2848a1a93e17
(cherry picked from commit c2ef7792fd17c5e54e4b82a63ea448d1f8310c31)
"}]
commit_message:
Use LUKS1 for certfs-ramfs for all distributions

This commit forces the use of LUKS1 in cryptsetup.

Centos uses LUKS2 by default in cryptsetup, ubuntu uses LUKS1.
Formating a LUKS2 block device is way longer than formating a LUKS1
device (15 sec vs 8 sec in my env) and LUKS2 doesn't provide any
significant features for octavia (it only improves recovery and
metadata).

The commit aslo limits the creation of more than 1 block ram device
(amphora doesn't need 16 ram devices), which reduces startup time.

Change-Id: I5cdc0a9ccc01548f195eed80f2ee2848a1a93e17
(cherry picked from commit c2ef7792fd17c5e54e4b82a63ea448d1f8310c31)

commit_message:
Increase concurrency when starting containers

When Paunch is disabled, we can make the container startup concurrent.
The default was set to 2 to avoid podman locks issues but it seems
that we have now better results when concurrency is higher.

Let's set it to 5 for now.

Change-Id: I707b2f66eb947d64ef6a21238dc26c81575be2c7

commit_message:
Revert "Make healthchecks more strict"

This reverts commit ba02b0a23582b286b775fd129e3a09970862755b.

Apparently this makes a specific healthcheck fail - some investigations are needed.
Reverting this patch allows to avoid dropping a CI check as done https://review.opendev.org/705051

Change-Id: I84648caf18bfa40160410c9b664cf55a1d8fae73

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2020-01-30 15:26:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks for doing this. The only thing I'm not sure about, is whether we need a release note for it. Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-01-31 09:06:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Thanks for doing this. The only thing I'm not sure about, is
 > whether we need a release note for it. Thoughts?

This class is really not used by anything, there's basically no impact whatsoever to users, I don't think a release note is necessary in this case."}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2020-01-31 14:02:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Thanks for doing this. The only thing I'm not sure about, is
 > > whether we need a release note for it. Thoughts?
 > 
 > This class is really not used by anything, there's basically no
 > impact whatsoever to users, I don't think a release note is
 > necessary in this case.

I'd second that, there is 0 user impact, it might be considered developer impact but not sure if the release notes are intended for such things and who would need to make use of this class, python2.6 support is long gone."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2020-02-01 02:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove VerifiedHTTPSConnection class

It was needed for now EOL python versions, was unused for quite
a while and is insecure (does not allow customising TLS version
for example).

Change-Id: Ia382d3fc155196e7cf916f57ee0ac6be7dde07af

commit_message:
Revert "Remove panko"

Revert Panko removal as CF integration work was not completed
on time for train compatibility.

This reverts commit 112f485c7fe1cc64445d3c09b2e9655026697225.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-02 20:48:41.000000000', 'message': "Define new ipv6-only job for OVN

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-release-ipv6-only'
run on check queue which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.
A future change can make this voting in the gate.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen
  address
- 'networking-ovn-tempest-ovs-release-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

Based on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673488/ from networking-ovn.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: Ia0dcf47ead268aa4b265904c9e1ae1e38d77456a
"}, {'created': '2020-01-02 20:53:37.000000000', 'message': "Define new ipv6-only job for OVN

commit_message:
Define new ipv6-only job for OVN

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'neutron-ovn-tempest-ovs-release-ipv6-only'
run on check queue which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.
A future change can make this voting in the gate.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen
  address
- 'networking-ovn-tempest-ovs-release-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35908

Based on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673488/ from networking-ovn.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703685/
Change-Id: Ia0dcf47ead268aa4b265904c9e1ae1e38d77456a

commit_message:
Permit OVS build can be set

Commit 00a74d1137abe78a0f34a73144ee7e2ccc486a32 change the OVS
package compile from source, this makes some neutron staduim
projects func gate has no permission accessing the "ovs" dir.

This patch adds a BUILD_OVS_FROM_SOURCE environment variables,
let it can be override by gate_hook.

Change-Id: Ib33fffbaaea6abfbd9719e0712918d4ae65b3ee2
Partial-Bug: #1861469

commit_message:
Fix sed in run-os-net-config to only replace values, not keys

The sed in run-os-net-config.sh replaces all instances of bridge_name
but it should only replace values, not keys.

Change-Id: Iaf19e1550bd7a5286b8512596efd84cf14c78f32
Closes-bug: #1854780
(cherry picked from commit 858cc6c54f690058ce28b0832870df875a7923e9)

commit_message:
Define orm relationships after db classes

This is to fix race conditions on neutron server init.
Please see bug for details.

Partial-Bug: #1824299
(cherry picked from commit 38daf9eaae8538c74933b19c952ad0612751c027)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-13 13:38:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health probe for several conductor workers

It was observed that when increasing amount of
conductor workers from default "1" to higher value
the readiness probe fails to check rabbitmq connections
for conductor processes - it happens since the script is trying
to obtain rabbitmq connections for parent conductor process
which in case of workers>1 doesn`t open rabbit connections
but spawns child processes which handle rabbitmq
connections instead.
This patch removes the "check-all-pids" option, keeps the logic
but simplifies and fastens he code - instead of checking all
processes when "check-all-pids" option was set (however
regardless of "sock_count value" if only one process opens connection
the check returns positive result) processes will be checked one-by-one
until the first one with open rabbitmq connection(s) is
found.

Change-Id: I72be0bbdefcba77a55b6ceed6e192c9621c069eb
'}, {'created': '2019-12-31 18:49:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health probe for several conductor workers

It was observed that when increasing amount of
conductor workers from default "1" to higher value
the readiness probe fails to check rabbitmq connections
for conductor processes - it happens since the script is trying
to obtain rabbitmq connections for parent conductor process
which in case of workers>1 doesn`t open rabbit connections
but spawns child processes which handle rabbitmq
connections instead.
This patch removes the "check-all-pids" option, keeps the logic
but simplifies and fastens he code - instead of checking all
processes when "check-all-pids" option was set (however
regardless of "sock_count value" if only one process opens connection
the check returns positive result) processes will be checked one-by-one
until the first one with open rabbitmq connection(s) is
found.

Change-Id: I72be0bbdefcba77a55b6ceed6e192c9621c069eb
'}, {'created': '2020-01-31 10:43:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix health probe for several conductor workers

It was observed that when increasing amount of
conductor workers from default "1" to higher value
the readiness probe fails to check rabbitmq connections
for conductor processes - it happens since the script is trying
to obtain rabbitmq connections for parent conductor process
which in case of workers>1 doesn`t open rabbit connections
but spawns child processes which handle rabbitmq
connections instead.
This patch removes the "check-all-pids" option, keeps the logic
but simplifies and fastens he code - instead of checking all
processes when "check-all-pids" option was set (however
regardless of "sock_count value" if only one process opens connection
the check returns positive result) processes will be checked one-by-one
until the first one with open rabbitmq connection(s) is
found.

Change-Id: I72be0bbdefcba77a55b6ceed6e192c9621c069eb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix health probe for several conductor workers

It was observed that when increasing amount of
conductor workers from default "1" to higher value
the readiness probe fails to check rabbitmq connections
for conductor processes - it happens since the script is trying
to obtain rabbitmq connections for parent conductor process
which in case of workers>1 doesn`t open rabbit connections
but spawns child processes which handle rabbitmq
connections instead.
This patch removes the "check-all-pids" option, keeps the logic
but simplifies and fastens he code - instead of checking all
processes when "check-all-pids" option was set (however
regardless of "sock_count value" if only one process opens connection
the check returns positive result) processes will be checked one-by-one
until the first one with open rabbitmq connection(s) is
found.

Change-Id: I72be0bbdefcba77a55b6ceed6e192c9621c069eb

commit_message:
Move haproxy certificate into variable

This change is necessary to be able to encrypt the certificate already
before Ansible 2.4 with Vault as a parameter. The decryption of entire
files using the copy task was introduced with Ansible 2.4.

Change-Id: I971abc2a42cc05bbe77fc15e2cb761fd4189b0a2

subject: Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync
messages:
[{'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2019-10-28 17:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2019-10-29 08:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-10-29 16:14:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

I think this is on the right track, I'd like to see some more unittests and i'm not sure the change in test_client is as obvious as it could be"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-10-29 16:28:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Ha! Looks like Clay beat me to it :-)

FWIW, the probe test timings came down great -- 36s to run test/probe/test_container_sync.py:TestContainerSync.test_sync_delete_when_object_never_synced before, now down to like 18s.

It may be out of scope for this change, but we should probably only retry 5xx errors and immediately raise on 4xx.

Agree with Clay that we'll want a test to guard against regressions."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-10-29 18:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have to ask, why not to retry the conflict, perhaps after a suitable delay? I understand why 404 makes no sense to retry when we ourselves are trying to delete.'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2019-10-31 16:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2019-10-31 16:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-05 14:23:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

So I'm torn... on the one hand, I feel like this is much closer to the API I was *expecting* to have... but on the other, Clay was talking to me about how SimpleClient was supposed to be, well, simple -- and maybe the smallest fix would be to *only retry* on socket.error, or urllib2.HTTPError if status is 5xx... And leave anything else to immediately raise.

Honestly, I'm not even sure what might cause us to raise urllib2.URLError, or why we think it would get fixed on a retry. :-/

Still -- 409s aren't going to get resolved by waiting a while, so I kinda still want that fix *somewhere*...

At the very least, as things are written now, we've got a busted test. Once we've got that fixed, I might be persuaded of whichever path you chose."}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2019-11-06 17:32:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)

I upload this patch to fix tests and some Tim remarks.

I like the patch as is, however I understand that arguments in internal_client.delete_object() method should stay as light as possible.
About the retry on 5xx (or socket error): I think it's a good idea :)
I am afraid that we break something by changing the behavior of retry_request. But, if we have a 4xx, we'll raise immediately, so it will be basically the same behavior as if we set the retries to 0."}, {'account_id': 27887, 'date': '2019-11-06 17:43:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-07 06:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-07 12:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Sorry, this is what happens when I do off-the-cuff design while confirming bug reports...'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-21 06:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-31 17:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

I rather like how this turned out, but I also had a pretty heavy hand in getting it where it is. Might be good for someone else to spot-check me on it.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-31 21:09:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(4 comments)

I'm really happy with where this ended up - thanks Gilles (and Tim!)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-28 17:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

The container-sync used to retry deletes ending with HTTP_NOT_FOUND and
HTTP_CONFLICT. This fix specify a list of acceptable status when calling
the retry_request in internal_client.py from the container/sync.py, so
it raises an exception at the first try for the listed status. This
prevents the loop to wait and retry for no reason, so the container-sync
can manage the exception earlier.

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841
'}, {'created': '2019-10-29 08:50:38.000000000', 'message': 'Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

The container-sync used to retry deletes ending with HTTP_NOT_FOUND and
HTTP_CONFLICT. This fix specify a list of acceptable status when calling
the retry_request in internal_client.py from the container/sync.py, so
it raises an exception at the first try for the listed status. This
prevents the loop to wait and retry for no reason, so the container-sync
can manage the exception earlier.

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841
'}, {'created': '2019-10-31 16:22:22.000000000', 'message': 'Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

The container-sync used to retry deletes ending with HTTP_NOT_FOUND and
HTTP_CONFLICT. This fix specify a list of acceptable status when calling
the retry_request in internal_client.py from the container/sync.py, so
it stops at the first try for the listed status. This prevents the loop
to wait and retry for no reason, so the container-sync can continue
sooner.

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841
'}, {'created': '2019-11-06 17:43:42.000000000', 'message': 'Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

The container-sync used to retry deletes ending with HTTP_NOT_FOUND and
HTTP_CONFLICT. This fix specify a list of acceptable status when calling
the retry_request in internal_client.py from the container/sync.py, so
it stops at the first try for the listed status. This prevents the loop
to wait and retry for no reason, so the container-sync can continue
sooner.

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841
'}, {'created': '2019-11-07 06:07:00.000000000', 'message': 'Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

The container-sync used to retry deletes ending with HTTP_NOT_FOUND and
HTTP_CONFLICT. This fix specify a list of acceptable status when calling
the retry_request in internal_client.py from the container/sync.py, so
it stops at the first try for the listed status. This prevents the loop
to wait and retry for no reason, so the container-sync can continue
sooner.

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841
'}, {'created': '2020-01-21 06:07:01.000000000', 'message': "Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

Internal clients used to retry operations even on client errors, where
we had no expectation that we would get a different response. Among
other things, this would cause container-sync to needlessly retry
deletes that would 404, even though we had code specifically in place to
say that 404s are OK.

While we're at it, also flag 409s as being OK (since the remote has
newer data than us).

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841
"}]
commit_message:
Stop retrying every deletes in container-sync

Internal clients used to retry operations even on client errors, where
we had no expectation that we would get a different response. Among
other things, this would cause container-sync to needlessly retry
deletes that would 404, even though we had code specifically in place to
say that 404s are OK.

While we're at it, also flag 409s as being OK (since the remote has
newer data than us).

Change-Id: I1833a8ff2ac2f4126b6274d6bba47e2b58a41745
Closes-Bug: #1849841

commit_message:
[Keystone] Fix status code logic

This patch set fixes an issue with where the keystone chart's
domain-manage job/pod always restart once due to a calculation
logic error.

Change-Id: I801d04559a526d3a7339cd5102f2e738af9f72e0
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
probe: Add test for syncing a delete when the remote 404s

This works fine; we continue processing the other rows in the DB. But it
*does* take longer than it really ought to require. See the related bug;
we ought to be able to shave some 17s off the test time by not retrying
on the 404.

Change-Id: I9ca2511651e9b2bc0045894baa4062d20bc15369
Related-Bug: #1849841

commit_message:
Fluentd: Update kernel and auth inputs to use systemd

This updates the overrides provided for deploying fluentd as a
daemonset to get kernel messages from the journal instead of
/var/log/kern.log directly, and also uses the journal to get
messages associated with logging to auth.log (syslog facility
10). This provides additional metadata and
a cleaner interface for gathering these logs via fluentd

Change-Id: I8e832db276095771d6a869e998d7a69795dfee37
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:47:53.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Reduce unnecessary gate image builds

Due to regex matching of images, we are currently building quite a few
unnecessary images in CI. Images that can unexpectedly match:

* barbican-keystone-listener
* ironic-neutron-agent
* prometheus-haproxy-exporter
* prometheus-memcached-exporter

This change improves the situation by anchoring matches to the start of
the name. A full solution would be to specify every image required for
each job. This would be quite verbose and require maintenance.

Change-Id: I7387ccd0cb394c54c79bfba8b1c09fce7ee2973e
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Reduce unnecessary gate image builds

Due to regex matching of images, we are currently building quite a few
unnecessary images in CI. Images that can unexpectedly match:

* barbican-keystone-listener
* ironic-neutron-agent
* prometheus-haproxy-exporter
* prometheus-memcached-exporter

This change improves the situation by anchoring matches to the start of
the name. A full solution would be to specify every image required for
each job. This would be quite verbose and require maintenance.

Change-Id: I7387ccd0cb394c54c79bfba8b1c09fce7ee2973e

commit_message:
turn off  validate_services

validate_services should be isolated
to it's own jobs and not append to current
check / gate jobs

containers-update is checking / gating
so depends on a fix for that job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704885
Change-Id: I30f474cfece69117acddfb6601cbff36bbe2c561

commit_message:
Revert "Use YAML anchors/aliases to reduce playbook task repetition"

This reverts commit bc4df9c5a994183c71347691e9eb3633e1c00951.

These don't always exist in the the same file because of
the usage of template. Some of these work but the updates
is broken now.

Change-Id: Id45eee817aff0a780f0fc2da2453bb8fec66d380
Closes-Bug: #1861335

lingering rally helm test pods.

commit_message:
Fix osc delete share and show share tests

Delete one share, force delete one share,
delete many shares and show share unit tests
were broken. Those failures were not caught up
because we were not running tests on our gate.

This patch set fix those tests. The dependeny will
add osc unit tests to main python jobs

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 17:51:06.000000000', 'message': "docs: Fix the monkeypatching of blockdiag

blockdiag has a longstanding bug whereby it tries to access an attribute
on an 'io.BufferedReader' that doesn't exist. We had previously fixed
this in change Ibd32d30aacae65702d0ccbdb8a02b1667ec4e8ee, which undid
the damage blockdiag was doing. However, this worked because the monkey
patching blockdiag does happens when the 'blockdiag.utils.compat' module
is loaded [1], which was happening implicitly with our import of
'blockdiag.imagedraw.textfolder' [2]. However, that module no longer
imports the 'compat' [3] module so this doesn't work. Fix the issue by
just importing the 'compat' module manually, triggering the monkey
patching...which we can then undo.

[1] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/blob/2.0.0/src/blockdiag/utils/compat.py#L19-L26
[2] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/blob/1.5.4/src/blockdiag/imagedraw/textfolder.py#L18
[3] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/tree/2.0.0/src/blockdiag/imagedraw/textfolder.py

Change-Id: Idacfff98842fde38fb39791090f2da3310b441b5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-01-31 17:53:18.000000000', 'message': "docs: Fix the monkeypatching of blockdiag

imports the 'compat' [3] module so this doesn't work. Fix the issue by

[2] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/blob/1.5.4/src/blockdiag/imagedraw/textfolder.py#L18

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Fix the monkeypatching of blockdiag

blockdiag has a longstanding bug whereby it tries to access an attribute
on an 'io.BufferedReader' that doesn't exist. We had previously fixed
this in change Ibd32d30aacae65702d0ccbdb8a02b1667ec4e8ee, which undid
the damage blockdiag was doing. However, this worked because the monkey
patching blockdiag does happens when the 'blockdiag.utils.compat' module
is loaded [1], which was happening implicitly with our import of
'blockdiag.imagedraw.textfolder' [2]. However, that module no longer
imports the 'compat' [3] module so this doesn't work. Fix the issue by
just importing the 'compat' module manually, triggering the monkey
patching...which we can then undo.

[1] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/blob/2.0.0/src/blockdiag/utils/compat.py#L19-L26
[2] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/blob/1.5.4/src/blockdiag/imagedraw/textfolder.py#L18
[3] https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/tree/2.0.0/src/blockdiag/imagedraw/textfolder.py

Change-Id: Idacfff98842fde38fb39791090f2da3310b441b5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

host introspection.

commit_message:
nova-libvirt: add UEFI packages to support UEFI instances

Fix inability to run UEFI-based images/instances by installing UEFI
packages also in nova-libvirt image which is not based on nova-base.

Includes support for C8.
Backport below Train w/o C8.

Closes-Bug: #1814552
Co-authored-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1d5cd3d9af98444acac5bedd7daeaa6c6673dcd6

Switch cli data to environment vars

In order to not have to do special shell quoting, we can use environment
vars to handle that instead.

Change-Id: Ie0c6ccc654ef3b04bcb0f4da81bad16220a973a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-11 18:44:21.000000000', 'message': "s3token: When caching is enabled, default auth_type to password

Otherwise, if you just set secret_cache_duration and skip configuring
auth_type, you get a not-very-obvious

    TypeError: sequence item 0: expected string, NoneType found

bubbling up from stevedore. Now, you'd get something like

    MissingRequiredOptions: Auth plugin requires parameters which were
    not given: auth_url

Change-Id: Ifddbb9df60207dfaaf0434877f4fe6af5c26bdf8
"}]
commit_message:
s3token: When caching is enabled, default auth_type to password

Otherwise, if you just set secret_cache_duration and skip configuring
auth_type, you get a not-very-obvious

    TypeError: sequence item 0: expected string, NoneType found

bubbling up from stevedore. Now, you'd get something like

    MissingRequiredOptions: Auth plugin requires parameters which were
    not given: auth_url

Change-Id: Ifddbb9df60207dfaaf0434877f4fe6af5c26bdf8

commit_message:
Return correct etag for raw manifest

When client sends a '?multipart-manifest=get&format=raw' request
middleware will change the manifest returned from object server.
This patch makes sure the response etag is updated to reflect
changes to manifest content

Change-Id: I0ac6dd0808fb041ba7663f4a472a06ee3f1d9a71

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-31 14:46:01.000000000', 'message': "Ensure store ID parsed from URI is properly encoded

Ensure the store ID parsed from a request URI is unicode. This fixes
a py27 issue that allowed an incorrectly encoded value to be added to
the image's metadata.

Support for py27 is dropped in Ussuri, but this fix is required on
earlier releases that do support py27.

Closes-Bug: #1861501
Change-Id: I5a1c61430879a910e7b6c79effba538431959d56
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure store ID parsed from URI is properly encoded

Ensure the store ID parsed from a request URI is unicode. This fixes
a py27 issue that allowed an incorrectly encoded value to be added to
the image's metadata.

Support for py27 is dropped in Ussuri, but this fix is required on
earlier releases that do support py27.

Closes-Bug: #1861501
Change-Id: I5a1c61430879a910e7b6c79effba538431959d56

commit_message:
Check "security_group_rule" quota during security group creation

The tracked resources quota check is done at the beginning of an API
call to the Neutron server. The API call contains a resource and an
action over the resource. In case of creation, the server checks if
the number of items requested fits in the existing quota.

In case of security group creation, the tracked resource checked is
"security_group". But "SecurityGroupDbMixin.create_security_group"
method also creates several default rules for the new group and the
quota for "security_group_rule" is not enforced.

This patch checks the number of security group rules being created
("delta") and checks in the plugin method (not in the API method) if
there is enough room for those new rules (tracked resource
"security_group_rule").

Change-Id: I0a9b91b09d6260ff96fdba2f0a455de53bbc1f00
Closes-Bug: #1858680

[{'created': '2019-06-07 10:37:33.000000000', 'message': "tox: Stop build *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref',
'api-guide' and 'placement-api-ref', in addition to 'doc'. This
massively increases the amount of time docs take to build both locally
and in the gate. It's not necessary for gate, since separate jobs take

(cherry picked from commit f49b81fa2bd692583370bab569f25215073a5bc2)
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Stop build *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref',
'api-guide' and 'placement-api-ref', in addition to 'doc'. This
massively increases the amount of time docs take to build both locally
and in the gate. It's not necessary for gate, since separate jobs take
care of the other documents for us [1]. As such, we should stop doing
it. For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new
'all-docs' target is included.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L5578-L5595

Change-Id: I58bd50e869fc00dde5dd388efb686a7196c8db80
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f49b81fa2bd692583370bab569f25215073a5bc2)

commit_message:
Revert "Make healthchecks more strict"

This reverts commit dddf584505bb24c53ba9d5fd92396695dc7a540c.

Apparently this makes a specific healthcheck fail - some
investigations are needed.
Reverting this patch allows to avoid dropping a CI check
as done https://review.opendev.org/705051

Master is being reverted - backport should be as well.

Change-Id: Ifbaa2d44550581d1acd9351b14192e6654cf05a1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-01-27 07:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-01-29 15:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-01-29 19:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It seems that a few other services also have the z flag on /var/run. Any particular reason why they were not considered in this patch (or better, in its master patch)?

database/redis-container-puppet.yaml:                  - /var/run/redis:/var/run/redis:z
neutron/neutron-ovs-agent-container-puppet.yaml:                  - /var/run/openvswitch/:/var/run/openvswitch/:shared,z
nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml:                  - /var/run/libvirt:/var/run/libvirt:shared,z
nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml:                  - /var/run/libvirt:/var/run/libvirt:shared,z
nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml:                      - /var/run/libvirt:/var/run/libvirt:shared,z
octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml:                      - /var/run/octavia:/var/run/octavia:shared,z

commit_message:
Drop z flag on /var/run, it prevents redeployment

This is related to
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1784608

In short, it will mess up selinux labeling for /var/run and it
is likely to break the system.

Change-Id: I111242773685c6461bd49dc564ae56072d1a7745
(cherry picked from commit 719d8329d285942157d8461f74af59001e5b8e4c)

I like the idea for adding tractability to the restored object for the stack versioning. However the change is questionable to me. The main reason for my -1 is the in-flight sysmeta change from versioned to the versionined container which keeps the original object. I think the sysmeta should be consistent with the source object as possible so I'm wondering why we don't add the sysmeta when "restoring *from versioned container* to the container which keeps versioned objects". (Sorry, the word could be complex. I mean, why we don't call the version sysmeta at around _copy_current)

Perhaps, it could be from backward compatibility but... if the version id sysmeta is not found at the object meta (because it publishes at the proxy), it sounds brittle to me.

Am i thinking too much?'}, {'account_id': 23861, 'date': '2017-05-04 10:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 23861, 'date': '2017-05-04 11:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-05-04 12:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

[{'created': '2017-02-23 16:49:42.000000000', 'message': 'Store version id if restoring object from archive

When the current object is deleted and the versioning mode is set to
"stack", an older object from the archive container is restored as the
current object.  The "version id" is only part of the object name when
it is in the archive container, which means that when it becomes the
current object, the "version id" is lost.  swift3 needs to know the
version id even after it is restored, but right now there is no way to
get the version id.

This change stores the version id as metadata
"X-Object-Meta-Version-Id" as the object is restored so it is possible
to get the version id.

Change-Id: Ic67584f98c41b68ce053c4e8f3449bb8bd148899
'}, {'created': '2017-03-27 15:54:59.000000000', 'message': 'Store version id if restoring object from archive

commit_message:
Store version id when copying object to archive

When the current object is deleted and the versioning mode is set to
"stack", an older object from the archive container is restored as the
current object.  The "version id" is only part of the object name when
it is in the archive container, which means that when it becomes the
current object, the "version id" is lost.  swift3 needs to know the
version id even after it is restored, but right now there is no way to
get the version id.

This change stores the version id as metadata
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Version-Id" when an object is copied to the archive
container and given a version id.

Change-Id: Ic67584f98c41b68ce053c4e8f3449bb8bd148899

subject: Add X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-03-01 23:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Clay,

I've got some ideas for why you wouldn't want to expose this to clients. As an account owner, you may create a container, enable versioning (with X-History-Location), then grant read/write access to another user with the expectation that they can't cause irreparable harm; if they issue any DELETEs, the data will still be safe in the archive container.

*Maybe* if we limit it to account owners? But that may complicate swift3's use-case...

That said, I like Alistair's suggestion to check for expected values. I'm thinking log a warning and ignore the header if it's not "history" or "stack"? If we *do* turn this into a client-facing feature, we could turn that into a 400 instead.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-03-02 02:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As an account owner, you may create a container, enable versioning (with
> X-History-Location), then grant read/write access to another user with the
> expectation that they can't cause irreparable harm; if they issue any
> DELETEs, the data will still be safe in the archive container.

Great point.  And even without exposing the param in the Swift API - would that risk still exist once you have a swift3 that supports X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override?

I like the idea of limiting the use of the Override to only users who would have been authorized to change the container versioning mode anyway - if that's possible."}, {'account_id': 23861, 'date': '2017-03-28 12:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-28 14:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1
