Thanks Rafael, I change the block to bash instead of dir.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2019-11-25 22:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2019-11-26 16:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

This looks really good. I haven't played with having multiple identity providers but looks correct."}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2019-11-26 16:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This looks really good. I haven't played with having multiple
 > identity providers but looks correct.

We also were not aware of that. It took almost a full month of debugging, testing, and inspecting code. The documentation is rather scarce. That is why we have other PR with an improvement in Keystone Documentation.

BTW, to make multiple IdPs to work, we need to patch Horizon, but that will be done in a PR shortly. The discovery process does not work as expected when we have multiple IdPs configured in Horizon."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-12-23 20:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(14 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2019-12-26 19:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30695, 'date': '2019-12-26 19:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2020-01-10 16:15:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Could have used this a month ago! Aiming to get OIDC support in openstack-ansible-os_keystone with support for this flow, so it's nice to verify that I've not been doing anything too stupid. I don't know whether its worth mentioning the Direct Access Grants in Keycloak somewhere because that could've caught me out - but perhaps that's a little too Keycloak specific. Brilliant work."}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-01-10 16:27:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-01-28 23:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2020-01-29 14:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-01-28 15:54:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove dracut-config-generic package

In LP#1830574, we introduce the dracut command to include necessary
file into initramfs. However, dracut in RHEL or CentOS doesn't include
sysctl.conf or other specific module related confs at an installation
of new kernel if dracut-config-generic package exists on the system.

We should remove the package to allow creating a host-specific initramfs
at an installation of new kernel.

Change-Id: I23bab883b23cf33ebd9f59399b265b87e6881ed4
Co-Authored-By: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove dracut-config-generic package

In LP#1830574, we introduce the dracut command to include necessary
file into initramfs. However, dracut in RHEL or CentOS doesn't include
sysctl.conf or other specific module related confs at an installation
of new kernel if dracut-config-generic package exists on the system.

We should remove the package to allow creating a host-specific initramfs
at an installation of new kernel.

Closes-bug: #1857493

Change-Id: I23bab883b23cf33ebd9f59399b265b87e6881ed4
Co-Authored-By: Keigo Noha <knoha@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add DeployIdentifier to extra config containers

Certain config containers might need to be replaced and re-run
regardless of whether configuration changes on update and upgrade.
Adding the DeployIdentifier to the env will ensure that they are.

Change-Id: I150212ebac3fed471ffb4e7ed7b6eb6c7af3fad9
Closes-Bug: #1860571

commit_message:
Raise exception on KeyboardInterrupt

Using subprocess with tenacity can lead to issues when a keyboard
interrupt occurs because the logic we have will actually trigger a
retry. This can lead to the inability to stop some of the commands with
a ctrl+c.

Change-Id: I294910384fc9dd9ca8c7114d08842868909d9e9f
Closes-Bug: #1746724

subject: Remove mistral workflow to return the ssh private key
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 00:13:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mistral workflow to return the ssh private key

This change uses the local file system to return the ssh private key which is
known to be stored in the working directory or in the users home folder.
As the method searchs, it attempts to open the key file to ensure that the
calling user has access to the key. In the event of a failure, the updated
method will return None, which the calling methods expect.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38437

Change-Id: Ie77ce22f23c7b8ac23203f790a20a548063d08f9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove mistral workflow to return the ssh private key

This change uses the local file system to return the ssh private key which is
known to be stored in the working directory or in the users home folder.
As the method searchs, it attempts to open the key file to ensure that the
calling user has access to the key. In the event of a failure, the updated
method will return None, which the calling methods expect.

Story: 2007212
Task: 38437

Change-Id: Ie77ce22f23c7b8ac23203f790a20a548063d08f9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
When resuming, exclude haproxy

When resuming services exclude those managed by hacluster, in
this case haproxy. If pacemaker lacks quorum it may shut haproxy
down which will cause this charm to error.

Charmhelper sync included to bring in required
get_managed_services_and_ports method.

Change-Id: I00fa695edb7651098d9c7afdd4df823d66a01aef

subject: Remove the openstack overcloud plan commands
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2020-01-28 14:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-01-28 14:57:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I find the possibility to download the plan on a failed deployment quite valuable. It allows me to read the heat templates in a more human friendly fully rendered version compared to the j2, run yaml validation tools etc. There is *magic* adding stuff to plan's that I can't see by simply running process templates tools.

Could we keep the plan exporter?"}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2020-01-28 14:58:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I find the possibility to download the plan on a failed deployment
 > quite valuable. It allows me to read the heat templates in a more
 > human friendly fully rendered version compared to the j2, run yaml
 > validation tools etc. There is *magic* adding stuff to plan's that
 > I can't see by simply running process templates tools.
 > 
 > Could we keep the plan exporter?

That sounds reasonable. I could see that being useful. It is worth noting that eventually we want to move the plan out of Swift, so all of this magic should run somewhere locally and then that command wont be need either."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-28 15:13:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2020-01-28 15:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2020-01-29 13:26:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Seems like we need to do this the hard way :)'}]

[{'created': '2020-01-28 14:20:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the openstack overcloud plan commands

With the removal of the TripleO UI the dedicated CLI commands for plan
management make less sense. These can help users manage the plans in
Swift, however, the deploy command empties the container and repopulates
it from the local files making any of these changes redundant.

story: 2007212

task: 38421
task: 38424
Change-Id: I8179884a9d444dc693e2be32dc6ea5d0f800f57c

commit_message:
Remove the openstack overcloud plan commands

With the removal of the TripleO UI the dedicated CLI commands for plan
management make less sense. These can help users manage the plans in
Swift, however, the deploy command empties the container and repopulates
it from the local files making any of these changes redundant.

story: 2007212
task: 38419
task: 38420
task: 38421
task: 38424
Change-Id: I8179884a9d444dc693e2be32dc6ea5d0f800f57c

commit_message:
[WIP] Fix unlimited share replica per share

This patch fixes a bug that makes the user able to create unlimited
share replicas from a given share. Now, we have some validations
in the share type and the administrator is able to specify how many
share replicas a given share type is able to support.

Change-Id: I4bd02918ff08711dfadbd129b70b79d843ef7634
Depends-On: I2c690b8740d3888c3737c880704c6d28bd7df47f
Closes-Bug:~#1850545

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-13 11:16:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove one of iptables_hybrid jobs

In check queue there were 2 iptables_hybrid jobs. One was run on Ubuntu
and one on Fedora.
During the Shanghai PTG we agreed to remove one of those jobs and left
only one of them to be run in both check and gate queues.

This commit removes iptables_hybrid job based on Ubuntu image. Now only
job based on latest Fedora will be run in Neutron CI.

Change-Id: If0adb7ca4e254f5b19375b471679bcc18e0c7790
'}, {'created': '2019-11-14 11:25:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove one of iptables_hybrid jobs

In check queue there were 2 iptables_hybrid jobs. One was run on Ubuntu
and one on Fedora.
During the Shanghai PTG we agreed to remove one of those jobs and left
only one of them to be run in both check and gate queues.

This commit removes iptables_hybrid job based on Fedora image.

Change-Id: If0adb7ca4e254f5b19375b471679bcc18e0c7790
'}]
commit_message:
Remove one of iptables_hybrid jobs

In check queue there were 2 iptables_hybrid jobs. One was run on Ubuntu
and one on Fedora.
During the Shanghai PTG we agreed to remove one of those jobs and left
only one of them to be run in both check and gate queues.

This commit removes iptables_hybrid job based on Fedora image.

Change-Id: If0adb7ca4e254f5b19375b471679bcc18e0c7790

commit_message:
Remove publishing job for transparency-policy

Transparency-policy repo is dead and the content lives on
www.openstack.org, remove the publishing. We can add it back if the repo
gets active again and publishes elsewhere.

Change-Id: I774cf28fe93e7b0337368e32884c3d7a2477ae54

commit_message:
Fix OVN agent devstack script to support IPv6

There are variables in devstack that should be used
for services listening endpoints which change depending
on what SERVICE_IP_VERSION is set to, 4 or 6. Use them
in the ovn_agent script to support IPv6.

Change ovsdb-server to listen on [$SERVICE_LOCAL_HOST]
if IPv6, else 127.0.0.1 if IPv4.

Change ovn-northd to listen on 0.0.0.0 instead of
$SERVICE_LISTEN_ADDRESS.

Un-quote the metadata host address if it is IPv6, i.e.
2001:db8::1, not [2001:db8::1].

Closes-bug: #1860612
Change-Id: I5e9b6b70b502caf9dd6ec78f293f9d4b5b45e360

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 14:51:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how netcat is called when started as server

Netcat started as server was started with "-e" option which,
according to documentation in [1] should be used to pass filename
of script which will be executed after connect.
In scenario tests we are not using any additional script,
but we are passing simple shell command which should be executed
("echo $msg"). That should be passed with "-c" option instead of
"-e" and this patch is changing exactly that.

[1] https://manpages.debian.org/testing/netcat-traditional/nc.1.en.html

Change-Id: Ib0a4e8bb6baf596f441539c6fb93ab2ebc4f98af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix how netcat is called when started as server

Netcat started as server was started with "-e" option which,
according to documentation in [1] should be used to pass filename
of script which will be executed after connect.
In scenario tests we are not using any additional script,
but we are passing simple shell command which should be executed
("echo $msg"). That should be passed with "-c" option instead of
"-e" and this patch is changing exactly that.

[1] https://manpages.debian.org/testing/netcat-traditional/nc.1.en.html

Change-Id: Ib0a4e8bb6baf596f441539c6fb93ab2ebc4f98af

commit_message:
CentOS 8: base and openstack-base images

Adds support to the base and openstack-base images for CentOS 8.
These images have been removed from the list of unbuildable images, and
replaced with all dependent images.

Change-Id: I18fba8a5c2f99b700990cbf41c76077a1ec2408a
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
Additional upgrade clarifications for cpu-resources

Based on feedback from the mailing list [1] and changes during
implementation. Key changes:

- We don't require an operator set both 'cpu_shared_set' and
  'cpu_dedicated_set'. Clarify why this is the case.

- Add an upgrade summary and summaries to each upgrade step, since this
  is by far the hairiest part of the whole exercise.

- Replace references to an optional prefilter with the scheduler
  aliasing with optional fallback functionality actually used

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/thread.html#7084

Change-Id: I468abe984d81c264a588f23d4b3804106339a597
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

I need a different brain on to fully grok this, but there's at least one aspect I'm not liking.

I agree this test helper is an absolute bear. It seems like it's trying to do too many things at once, via conditionals, such that it's probably not really DRYing much; it's just really complicated. [{'created': '2019-06-10 11:04:23.000000000', 'message': "tests: Cleanup of '_test_resize' helper test

This is way too complicated for it's own good so clean things up:

- Remove the 'test_migrate_request_spec_not_found' which was checking
  the behavior of the 'RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid' function when a
  'RequestSpec' isn't found. This might be useful if we were attempting
  to handle this exception but we're not
- Remove a useless 'if' statement that was already covered by internal
  'if' statements
- Rename the 'flavor_id_passed' parameter to 'is_resize' to better
  describe what it's doing to the test
- Remove a mock for the 'Migration' object that was never going to get
  called

Change-Id: If117929305590a111a470640ef5bab4b9f3bbb94
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tests: Cleanup of '_test_resize' helper test

This is way too complicated for its own good so clean things up:

- Remove the 'test_migrate_request_spec_not_found' which was checking
  the behavior of the 'RequestSpec.get_by_instance_uuid' function when a
  'RequestSpec' isn't found. This might be useful if we were attempting
  to handle this exception but we're not
- Remove a useless 'if' statement that was already covered by internal
  'if' statements
- Rename the 'flavor_id_passed' parameter to 'is_resize' to better
  describe what it's doing to the test
- Remove a mock for the 'Migration' object that was never going to get
  called

Change-Id: If117929305590a111a470640ef5bab4b9f3bbb94
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create infrared plugin

The review adds required files (infrared_plugin/ folder) by Infrared
in order to make the role an infrared plugin.

- adds 'infrared' molecule scenario (run with pytest -k infrared)
- fix missing html report generation from tox molecule

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-07 00:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use pycodestyle in place of pep8

The lower version of pycodestyle lib (aliased to pep8) doesn't work
for py36 env. This commit unblocks the py36 gate by adding a
dependency on pycodestyle and using that for style checks.

Bump the "hacking" lib version to v1.1.0 which depends
on a higher verion of pycodestyle.

Change-Id: I6c950d054f18ed0bca92a32e921d2e9d387bcdbd
Closes-Bug: #1858410
'}, {'created': '2020-01-07 04:12:39.000000000', 'message': 'Use pycodestyle in place of pep8

commit_message:
Use pycodestyle in place of pep8

The lower version of pycodestyle lib (aliased to pep8) doesn't work
for py36 env. This commit unblocks the py36 gate by adding a
dependency on pycodestyle and using that for style checks.

Bump the "hacking" lib version to v1.1.0 which depends
on a higher verion of pycodestyle.

Change-Id: I6c950d054f18ed0bca92a32e921d2e9d387bcdbd
Closes-Bug: #1858410

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sbârnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 🥕'}]

[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-07-30 15:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-07-31 15:28:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 07:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 09:28:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 10:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 13:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

verify-rdo'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 16:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 17:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-08-06 17:30:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

We're actively moving jobs to a native zuul approach instead of using tox-molecule. This is being done due to the ongoing issues we've had with the tox-molecule job and its limitations of requiring docker."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-08-06 17:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Kevin, do not confuse the need to use nodepool inventory with the containter based approach.

Moving testing playbooks into zuul/ destroys the test-locally approach, which was one of molecule major selling points.

We can make delegated work with nodepool nodes, without having to break the local use scenario, and without requiring docker.

My goal here is to allow developer to run tests locally using a single tox command like `tox -e molecule` or `tox -e molecule-delegated`.

Key here is "simplicity".

Current setup lacks this simplicity, when I run "tox -a" I don't get any environment that can be used to perform that testing.

On the other hand, I think it should be easy to move zuul pre.yaml into molecule/default/prepare.yml and make it work without a fuss. Same preparatory code, but instead of letting zuul run it, we let molecule run it (so it can work for both CI and local testing).

If done right, we should be able to clone the repo on a centos-8 or rhel-8 machine and run it there in delegated mode, and see whatever we missed for newer platforms.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-01-29 10:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Adopt standardized openstack-tox-molecule

Detects and runs all molecule testing scenarios in current repository.

The purpose of this change is to enable the testing job as non-voting,
not to make it pass. Making job pass and later voting should be done
in follow-ups.

Change-Id: I8aeefeaa3bd5fe5a6407c2959b3320c5559d6480
Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/21728/

commit_message:
Improve loading of operating system specific vars

Improves the overlayed var loading pattern by addressing two problems
with current implementation:

* Avoid confusion between os_family and distribution
* Loads all files, allowing to define variable in less places

That newer pattern is already used in few other repositories.

More details on https://docs.sbarnea.com/ansible/ansible-disto-vars

Change-Id: I05651bff4eb85fda37eddb80074c23ac48b71201

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: Ib78f66723209abe9b4b94630926ab0a776d559d1

environment variables needed for the command to work properly

commit_message:
Add ability to update containers

We need to run the prep-containers role a second time to prepare
the containers we will use in an update. This commit adds that second
run.

Depends-On: I658f09b531e9659c192eeede6cdebf392c4d8281
Change-Id: Ibf1a0018fd6db65440d6a00acde2c8de92f441fc

commit_message:
Place the value of EXTRA_VARS into env_vars_to_source_file

We need the value of this so that dlrn_hash_tag_newest is included.
Also keep the literal '$EXTRA_VARS' so that it will be included if
set when the env_vars_to_source_file script is sourced.

Change-Id: I65590c1ee1b1c7546d151e7a3eb59b95cdb465e1

commit_message:
For stock centos/rhel images add repo and stack user

This patch would make the undercloud_install work for libvirt based
deployments with stock centos and rhel image. The problem is
described in more detail on the bug:1709833

Change-Id: If4e212bf8bdd08de0eca887ad0f81eed913449a3
Related-Bug: 1709833

[{'created': '2020-01-17 13:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinderlib RPM to cinder-volume

Finding the root cause of attach/detach operation on volumes can be very
complicated.

This patch adds the cinderlib RPM to the cinder-volume container, which

commit_message:
Add cinderlib RPM to cinder-volume

Finding the root cause of attach/detach operation on volumes can be very
complicated.

This patch adds the cinderlib RPM to the cinder-volume container, which
can, in many scenarios, really help debug these issues on live nodes
(controller and compute) without affecting our running services.

Change-Id: I5f55c892b1ae9eba9b6af8a45ef7dfad515c7b05
